str2: When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
Safety, security, reliability, firmness. From asphales; security.
Ruin, doom, destruction, death. From a primary ollumi; ruin, i.e. Death, punishment.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Unexpected, sudden. From a compound of a and phaino; unexpected, i.e. suddenly.
Just as, as, even as. From hos and per; just as, i.e. Exactly like.
The pain of childbirth, acute pain, severe agony, a snare. Akin to odune; a pang or throe, especially of childbirth.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To flee out, away, escape; with an acc: I escape something. From ek and pheugo; to flee out.
